See also: Glauben

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German gelouben, glouben, from Old High German gilouben, from Proto-Germanic *galaubijanÄ…. Cognate with Old Saxon gilÅÆ€ian, Middle Low German gelÈ«ven, Middle Dutch ghelÅven, Dutch geloven, Old English gelÄ“fan, gelÄ«efan (see also English believe, from Old English belÈ³fan, belÄ“fan), Gothic ğŒ²ğŒ°ğŒ»ğŒ°ğŒ¿ğŒ±ğŒ¾ğŒ°ğŒ½ (galaubjan).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ËˆÉ¡laÊŠÌ¯bmÌ©/, /ËˆÉ¡laÊŠÌ¯bÉ™n/
  • audio
    		(file)

Verb[edit]

glauben (third-person singular simple present glaubt, past tense glaubte, past participle geglaubt, auxiliary haben)

  1. to believe (to think someone/something exists = an + acc.; to think something someone says is correct = dat.)
    Glaubst du an Engel?
    Do you believe in angels?
    Niemand kann ihm glauben.
    No one can believe him.
    Woran glaubst du?
    What do you believe in?
  2. to think
    Glaubst du das ist so richtig?
    Do you think this is right like this?
